availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel A. Vance (Daviess County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Townsley Vance. Father of Amanda J. Vance, Priscilla Vance, Thomas E. Vance, Pembrook S. Vance, Sarah E. Vance, Susan H. Vance, and John W. Vance. Farmer in Knox County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Daviess County in July 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Knox County, Subdivision 15, p. 198B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 937.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Bells, p. 340A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994033, Daviess County Births, p. 297.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Daviess County, KY, July 1863, p. 36.
